drupalNodeEvent.title: China100 @ UH Mānoa: Online Exhibit to Commemorate 100 Years of Chinese Studies at the University of Hawai‘i, Mānoa

field_speakers.processed:
Shana Brown, Associate Professor of History, the University of Hawaii at Mānoa

Song Jiang, Associate Professor of Chinese Language & Linguistics, the University of Hawaii at Mānoa

Dongyun Ni, Chinese Studies Librarian, Hamilton Library, the University of Hawaii at Mānoa

field_organizers.processed: The University of Hawaii at Mānoa Center for Chinese Studies

field_description.processed:
Please join us in celebrating the launch of this online exhibit to commemorate the centennial of Chinese studies at the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa. We focus on the first fifty years (1920-1970), highlighting the evolution of academic units, the contributions of faculty, and the creation of our library collection. We welcome your comments, questions, and suggestions, and hope that former students and UH faculty will share memories and contribute materials.

Please register here: https://hawaii.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_uRuUHWQWS22maZ5oaEbCqw
